title: Mona Lisa
description: The "Mona Lisa", also known as "Gioconda", is an oil painting on wood created by Leonardo da Vinci between 1503 and 1506. It measures 30 x 21 cm. This artwork is considered one of the masterpieces of world painting and one of the most famous works in the history of art. It depicts a young woman with a smiling expression, seated in front of a background landscape. The Mona Lisa is renowned for her enigmatic smile and innovative use of light and shadow to create depth. Since its creation, it has been displayed in numerous museums around the world and is currently exhibited at the Louvre Museum in Paris.
